detaileddescription.para: Construct an instance of Sd2Card.
Determine the size of an SD flash memory card.

simplesect.para: The number of 512 byte data blocks in the card or zero if an error occurs.

detaileddescription.para: Erase a range of blocks.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the first block in the range.
The address of the last block in the range.

simplesect.para: This function requests the SD card to do a flash erase for a range of blocks. The data on the card after an erase operation is either 0 or 1, depends on the card vendor. The card must support single block erase.
The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if card supports single block erase.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned if single block erase is supported. The value zero, false, is returned if single block erase is not supported.
error code for last error. See Sd2Card.h for a list of error codes.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize an SD flash memory card with default clock rate and chip select pin. See sd2Card::init(uint8_t sckRateID, uint8_t chipSelectPin).
Initialize an SD flash memory card with the selected SPI clock rate and the default SD chip select pin. See sd2Card::init(uint8_t sckRateID, uint8_t chipSelectPin).
Initialize an SD flash memory card.

parameterdescription.para: SPI clock rate selector. See setSckRate().

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure. The reason for failure can be determined by calling errorCode() and errorData().

detaileddescription.para: Enable or disable partial block reads.

Enabling partial block reads improves performance by allowing a block to be read over the SPI bus as several sub-blocks. Errors may occur if the time between reads is too long since the SD card may timeout. The SPI SS line will be held low until the entire block is read or readEnd() is called.
Use this for applications like the Adafruit Wave Shield.
Returns the current value, true or false, for partial block read.
Read a 512 byte block from an SD card device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the location that will receive the data.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t block, uint16_t offset, uint16_t count, uint8_t *dst)
memberdef.name: readData

detaileddescription.para: Read part of a 512 byte block from an SD card.

parameterdescription.para: Number of bytes to skip at start of block
Pointer to the location that will receive the data.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

detaileddescription.para: Read a cards CID register. The CID contains card identification information such as Manufacturer ID, Product name, Product serial number and Manufacturing date.
Read a cards CSD register. The CSD contains Card-Specific Data that provides information regarding access to the card's contents.
Skip remaining data in a block when in partial block read mode.
Set the SPI clock rate.

sckRateID
A value in the range [0, 6].
The SPI clock will be set to F_CPU/pow(2, 1 + sckRateID). The maximum SPI rate is F_CPU/2 for sckRateID = 0 and the minimum rate is F_CPU/128 for scsRateID = 6.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for an invalid value of sckRateID.

detaileddescription.para: Return the card type: SD V1, SD V2 or SDHC
Writes a 512 byte block to an SD card.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the location of the data to be written.
If the write should be blocking.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

detaileddescription.para: Write one data block in a multiple block write sequence
Start a write multiple blocks sequence.

parameterdescription.para: Address of first block in sequence.
The number of blocks to be pre-erased.

simplesect.para: This function is used with writeData() and writeStop() for optimized multiple block writes.
The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

detaileddescription.para: End a write multiple blocks sequence.

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned for success and the value zero, false, is returned for failure.

detaileddescription.para: Check if the SD card is busy

simplesect.para: The value one, true, is returned when is busy and the value zero, false, is returned for when is NOT busy.

detaileddescription.para: read CID or CSR register
Wait for start block token

briefdescription.para: Raw access to SD and SDHC flash memory cards.
